rationales.power: He is preoccupied with personal credit and influence after his performance gains are attributed to someone else.
rationales.conformity: He suppresses confrontation in the call due organizational politics and hierarchy constraints.

rationales.hedonism: He cannot enjoy a celebratory bottle because status concerns dominate the evening.
rationales.achievement: He ties his identity to demonstrable performance and advancement readiness.
rationales.power: He explicitly frames name recognition as currency for moving into higher authority roles.

rationales.hedonism: He gives up a planned dinner experience because operational demands consume the day.
rationales.achievement: He personally steps onto the floor for hours to keep output moving when leads are absent.

rationales.hedonism: Even during sailing time he remains mentally at work, undermining enjoyment he chose.
rationales.power: He seeks documentation and strategic positioning to protect influence after being sidelined.
rationales.conformity: He smiles through condescension and keeps the interaction socially smooth despite resentment.

rationales.achievement: He treats staffing decisions as execution leverage for hub performance outcomes.
rationales.power: He explicitly values having budget authority and unilateral selection control.

rationales.hedonism: He deliberately centers sensory enjoyment and social pleasure in the dinner experience.
rationales.power: He simultaneously uses the event to cultivate high-value industry relationships for influence.

rationales.hedonism: He cancels a planned Bruges weekend and spends it working instead of resting with Lotte.
rationales.achievement: He prioritizes schedule recovery and execution pressure over personal time to protect Q3 outcomes.
rationales.benevolence: His choice sidelines his partner's plans and shared time despite knowing the emotional cost.

rationales.hedonism: He intentionally disconnects and enjoys sailing, food, and stillness as ends in themselves.
rationales.power: He overrides the site manager's layout to impose his own operational control.

rationales.hedonism: His attention stays on career escalation even as he anticipates major losses in leisure and lifestyle quality.
rationales.power: He remains strongly oriented toward executive scope, prestige, and decision authority.
